questions.question: Which oxide in cement is primarily responsible for strength development?

explanations.c: Calcium oxide ($\text{CaO}$) reacts with water to form hydration compounds responsible for strength development in cement.

questions.question: What is the role of SO₃ in cement composition?

explanations.b: $\text{SO}_3$ (Sulfur Trioxide) helps prevent flash setting, which occurs due to the rapid hydration of $\text{C}_3\text{A}$ (Tricalcium Aluminate).

questions.question: Which oxide in cement contributes to early strength and lowers clinkering temperature?

explanations.b: $\text{Al}_2\text{O}_3$ (Alumina) reduces the clinkering temperature and promotes early strength development in cement.

questions.question: Which oxide helps in preventing alkali-silica reaction (ASR)?

explanations.d: $\text{Na}_2\text{O}$ and $\text{K}_2\text{O}$ (alkali oxides) react with silica in aggregates, causing ASR. Controlling their content prevents this reaction.

questions.question: What is the main function of Fe₂O₃ in cement?

answers.c: Assists in clinker formation and impacts color

explanations.c: $\text{Fe}_2\text{O}_3$ (Iron Oxide) helps in clinker formation and gives cement its characteristic gray color.

questions.question: What is the purpose of adding ammonium oxalate ($(\text{NH}_4)_2\text{C}_2\text{O}_4$) during the determination of $\text{CaO}$?

explanations.a: Ammonium oxalate is used to precipitate calcium as calcium oxalate, which is further analyzed for $\text{CaO}$ content.

questions.question: Why is nitric acid ($\text{HNO}_3$) used in the determination of $\text{SiO}_2$ in cement?

answers.c: To acidify the solution and convert silica into insoluble form

explanations.c: Nitric acid acidifies the solution and helps convert silica ($\text{SiO}_2$) into an insoluble form for precise determination.

questions.question: What is the key method for determining the percentage of Fe₂O₃ in cement?

explanations.a: Titration using $\text{KMnO}_4$ (Potassium Permanganate) is commonly used for $\text{Fe}_2\text{O}_3$ determination due to its oxidizing properties.

questions.question: What compound is precipitated to determine the MgO content in cement?

explanations.b: Magnesium ammonium phosphate ($\text{MgNH}_4\text{PO}_4$) is the compound formed and precipitated for $\text{MgO}$ content determination.

questions.question: What is the function of tetracalcium aluminoferrite ($\text{C}_4\text{AF}$) in cement?

answers.b: Improves workability but contributes minimal strength

explanations.b: $\text{C}_4\text{AF}$ (Tetracalcium Aluminoferrite) mainly improves workability and has a minor role in strength development.

questions.question: What is the main reason for using low-heat cement in mass concrete structures?

answers.b: It reduces the risk of thermal cracking

explanations.b: Low-heat cement generates less heat during hydration, reducing the risk of thermal cracking in large structures.
